result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn Fields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate State/County Institution Laws [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.73.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Emailed dispatch on 9/12/22 at 2:57 PM to cancel warrant.

10:59 AM Defendant Shawn Fields in court, in custody.  Attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 

Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - GUILTY
State consents to jury waiver. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY.
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 60 days Racine County Jail to run concurrent with sentence the defendant is currently serving. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA surcharge, reduced to civil judgement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Clerk emailed transport to cancel WRIT as ADA Rutz indicated the case is resolved.

09:35 AM Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shawn Fields not in court, in custody. 
Unable to utilize Polycom system for defendant to appear by phone. RCI does not have availability for defendant to appear by phone.
BTC: Matter set over.
for Shawn Fields from Racine Correctional for Jury Trial on Thursday, June 23, 2022 at 8:30 a.m. - emailed RCSO at 9:19 a.m.
Jury trial on June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

BTC; Warrant remains, forfeit bond.
